UYAFC were frustrated by a lack of precision in the final third as they were beaten 3-1 by Hull at the 3G

Men's volleyball lose out to Northumbria in close encounter

The York volleyball men's firsts fell marginally short of victory inside the chilly Sports Tent on Wednesday evening, as Northumbria's men's seconds team closed out a victory against the home side

Phenomenal serving streak propels York to volleyball victory

The York women's volleyball first team claimed a comprehensive 3-1 victory over Leeds Metropolitan this afternoon in the Sport Tent, with the highlight of the match undoubtedly being an incredible nineteen-point serving streak held by York's Jessica Goodsell.

Gallant women's rugby side thrash depleted Newcastle

York quickly adapted to a reduced team size and uncontested scrum rules to dominate play against an eleven-player and inexperienced Newcastle seconds side in the women's rugby on 22 acres this afternoon, winning 78-0.

Vanbrugh recovered from their horror show against Langwith last week and moved up to second in the table with a 2-1 victory over James on Sunday

Derwent miss chance to go top after stalemate

Derwent missed the chance to go top of the league with a game in hand after being held to a goalless draw by Wentworth on Sunday.

Birthday-boy Bugeja seals victory to lift Alcuin off the bottom

A Ben Bugeja wonder-strike in the dying minute of the game sealed victory for Alcuin on a sunny 22 Acres, allowing the Owls to leap-frog their opponents Langwith off the bottom of the table.

By James Bithell

Langwith thrashed a disappointing Vanbrugh side on Sunday to end an agonising two-year wait for a College Football win.

Men's water polo firsts claim three points in Sheffield tournament

The men's firsts water polo contingent of UYSWC managed to take one win out of three matches in yesterday's tournament at Pond's Forge, Sheffield, in the club's first fixtures of the season.

A controversial 80th minute penalty was the difference between the two sides, as Goodricke edged Alcuin 2-1 on Sunday

A day that began with a hard-earned win over Leeds Met ended with a ruthless destruction of Manchester, as York ran out 12-2 winners in their final fixture

York fell to 6-3 defeat at the hands of Northumbria in their second futsal match of the day

York's futsal team made the ideal start to their BUCS season, with a 4-3 win over Leeds Met this morning

UYSWC look forward to season openers

The men's water polo side begin their BUCS season with three fixtures tomorrow, as they look to build on the form that saw them gain promotion last year.

Late goals earn York draw against Northumbria in thriller

Despite going into the 90th minute trailing by two goals, York women's firsts produced a fantastic finish to a thrilling 8 goal second-half. Jess Craig and Anty Cole both scored to rescue York, in a match that had seen Northumbria come back from their own two goal deficit.

Men's firsts overpowered by impressive Leeds

Despite winning the opening set, York's volleyball men's firsts crashed out to an impressive Leeds firsts side, whose sheer power allowed them to eventually shrug aside the home team.
